articles.title: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’
articles.description:
“Tom Brady, I believe, is the greatest quarterback of all time, by a wide margin.”

The post Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza enthralled by possibility of Tom Brady mentorship: ‘It would mean so much’ appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Top NFL Draft prospect Fernando Mendoza expresses desire for mentorship from Tom Brady.
Mendoza considers Brady the greatest quarterback, highlighting his influence on aspiring players.
Brady's potential mentorship could inspire Boston's youth and elevate local football programs.

articles.title: DHS says deported Babson student skipped flight. Her lawyers say agents wanted to detain her.
articles.description:
Court filings indicate the government planned to detain her in Texas and could seek to deport her again within days.

The post DHS says deported Babson student skipped flight. Her lawyers say agents wanted to detain her. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: DHS claims a Babson student skipped a deportation flight scheduled for Texas.
Her lawyers allege agents intended to detain her before deportation.
This incident raises concerns about immigration enforcement practices affecting Boston students.

articles.title: Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision
articles.description:
“We got the wind knocked out of both of us I think a little bit there.”

The post Red Sox’ Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela say they’re fine after outfield collision appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Roman Anthony and Ceddanne Rafaela collided in the outfield during a game.
Both players reported feeling fine after the incident on February 27.
Their recovery ensures continued support for the Red Sox as the season progresses.

articles.title: Bill Clinton says he ‘did nothing wrong’ with Epstein
articles.description:
“We are only here because he hid it from everyone so well for so long,” Bill Clinton said in his opening statement.

The post Bill Clinton says he ‘did nothing wrong’ with Epstein appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Bill Clinton stated he 'did nothing wrong' regarding his association with Jeffrey Epstein.
Clinton emphasized Epstein's ability to conceal his actions from the public for years.
The statement may influence local discussions on accountability and public trust in leaders.
